title: Mourning the death of Gerald Galusha, distinguished citizen and devoted member of his community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning  the  death of Gerald Galusha, distin-
guished citizen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Gerald "Jerry" Galusha of Seneca  Falls,  New  York  died  on
Friday, November 5, 2010, at the age of 46; and
  WHEREAS, Gerald Galusha distinguished himself in his profession and by
his  sincere  dedication  and substantial contribution to the welfare of
his community; and
  WHEREAS, Gerald Galusha's commitment to excellence, and his spirit  of
humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise, including charita-
ble and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS,  Gerald  Galusha is a 1982 graduate of Mynderse Academy where
he excelled at football, wrestling and lacrosse; he later  attended  the
State University College of Technology at Canton; and
  WHEREAS,  Gerald Galusha worked for Kelsey Construction, Goulds Pumps,
Inc, and most recently, the Department of Public Works for  the  Village
of Seneca Falls; and
  WHEREAS,  Active  in  the  community  by coaching and coordinating the
youth lacrosse program for 17 years, Gerald Galusha served on the Seneca
Falls Parks and Recreation Center Booster  Club,  the  Mynderse  Academy
Soccer Booster Club and the Mynderse Academy Steering Committee; and
  WHEREAS,  Gerald  Galusha  loved  to  coach youth baseball, soccer and
lacrosse, but the greatest joy of his life was his family; and
  WHEREAS, Predeceased by his mother, Maria Galusha, Gerald  Galusha  is
survived  by  his wife, Nancy, his sons, Daniel and Phillip, his father,
Dominick Galusha II, his brother Dominick Galusha III, along  with  many
other friends and family; and
  WHEREAS,  Armed  with  a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with a sense of
compassion, and comforted by a  loving  family,  Gerald  Galusha  leaves
behind  a  legacy  which  will  long endure the passage of time and will
remain as a comforting memory to all  he  served  and  befriended;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
mourn the death of Gerald Galusha,  distinguished  citizen  and  devoted
member of his community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Gerald "Jerry" Galusha.
